intro: Strombosiopsis congolensis, commonly known as the Congo strombosiopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Strombosiopsis congolensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
